t: Psalm 9
I Will Recount Your Wonderful Deeds
To the choirmaster: according to Muth-labben. A Psalm of David.
I*pn will give thanks to the Lord*s with my whole heart; I*ld will recount all of your wonderful deeds.
I*ln will be glad and exult in you; I*ld will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
When*pn my enemies turn back, they*ld stumble and perish before your presence.
For*ln you have maintained my just cause; you*ld have sat on the throne, giving righteous judgment.
You*pn have rebuked the nations; you have made the wicked perish; you*ld have blotted out their name forever and ever.
The*ln enemy came to an end in everlasting ruins; their*ld cities you rooted out; the*ld very memory of them has perished.
But*pn the Lord*s sits enthroned forever; he*ld has established his throne for justice,
and*ln he judges the world with righteousness; he*ld judges the peoples with uprightness.
The*pn Lord*s is a stronghold for the oppressed, a*ld stronghold in times of trouble.
And*ln those who know your name put their trust in you, for*ld you, O Lord,*s have not forsaken those who seek you.
Sing*pn praises to the Lord,*s who sits enthroned in Zion! Tell*ld among the peoples his deeds!
For*ln he who avenges blood is mindful of them; he*ld does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
Be*pn gracious to me, O Lord!*s See*ld my affliction from those who hate me, O*ld you who lift me up from the gates of death,
that*ln I may recount all your praises, that*ld in the gates of the daughter of Zion I*ld may rejoice in your salvation.
The*pn nations have sunk in the pit that they made; in*ld the net that they hid, their own foot has been caught.
The*ln Lord*s has made himself known; he has executed judgment; the*ld wicked are snared in the work of their own hands. Higgaion.*ig Selah*i
The*pn wicked shall return to Sheol, all*ld the nations that forget God.
For*pn the needy shall not always be forgotten, and*ld the hope of the poor shall not perish forever.
Arise,*pn O Lord!*s Let not man prevail; let*ld the nations be judged before you!
Put*ln them in fear, O Lord!*s Let*ld the nations know that they are but men! Selah*ig
